list_definition.definition: to praise or show approval, by clapping the hands

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The crowd applauded Jack’s speech enthusiastically.

list_ex_of_english: In so far as the committee's report will help in that good work, it is doubly to be applauded.
Such an ambitious undertaking must be applauded.
However, although one always applauds zeal, this really is excessive.
The new freedom given on vesting day last month to many polytechnics and colleges hitherto under direct local authority control has been widely applauded.
The dog showed great 'sagacity' in retrieving both lots, which the judges and the crowd applauded.
In part this is to be applauded: it makes for ambitious books that vie for a claim to establish the intellectual center of the period.
Anything that can prevent vehicle crime is to be applauded, and anything that can use new technology is to be applauded.
Through play, children often transcend age and gender ; they are applauded for playing at ' being ' adults.
